page.title: 13RESTORATION OF WHITEHAVEN.
page.content: Whitehaven is unique in that private industry and a local authority join togther in an ambitious restoration scheme.Whitehaven,once a town of shipbuilding & coal mining,is being helped by one of the most modern industries_Nuclear Energy.Copeland Borough Council & British Nuclear Fuels P.L.C. are together restoring part of the Georgian town centre.In order to retain the character of principal buildings they & their surroundings are being restored.Within the past 12 years new & revitalised houses have encouraged people to return to live in the town centre. B.N.F.L. provide 6500 permanent jobs in the area & have undertaken to restore some of the most dilapidated houses.One of the buildings restored is the Golden Lion Hotel on the corner of Market Place & Roper Street.
